benchmark_details.name: PanoSent (Panoptic Sextuple Extraction Benchmark for Multimodal Conversational Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis)
benchmark_details.overview: PanoSent is a dataset designed for multimodal conversational Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis (ABSA) that incorporates the Panoptic Sentiment Sextuple Extraction and Sentiment Flipping Analysis tasks, covering multiple languages and scenarios.
benchmark_details.data_type: multimodal dialogue with sextuple elements including holder, target, aspect, opinion, sentiment, and rationale

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for evaluating multimodal conversational Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis, enhancing the understanding of sentiment dynamics in dialogues.

data.source: Real-world dialogues collected from diverse social media platforms and synthesized using OpenAI GPT-4
data.annotation: Manually and automatically annotated with a focus on high-quality benchmarks.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores are calculated for sextuple extraction and sentiment flipping tasks based on precision and recall metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance in accurately predicting sentiment sextuples and sentiment flipping.
methodology.baseline_results: Various multimodal large language models and benchmarked systems as baselines.
methodology.validation: Rigorous validation using manual inspections and cross-validation techniques.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset ensures anonymization of personal information and complies with data protection regulations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution International 4.0 License.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data collected from publicly available sources with explicit consent obtained where necessary.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Compliance with GDPR and CCPA regulations.
